video.title: Kabir (1) - Selected Verses and Teachings for Meditation - Sufi Mysticism - Hindu Bhakti
video.description:
A selection of Kabir quotes and pointers intended for contemplation and meditation. Includes the song lyrics written by Snatam Kaur about and for Kabir. Kabir says: " Sing such a song with all of your heart that you'll never have to sing again."

Kabir Das was a 15th-century Indian mystic poet and saint, whose writings influenced Hinduism's Bhakti movement and his verses are found in Sikhism's scripture Guru Granth Sahib. His early life was in a Muslim family, but he was strongly influenced by his teacher, the Hindu bhakti leader Ramananda. Kabir was born in the Indian city of Varanasi but spent most of his life in the city of Faridabad near Delhi.

Music credits:
Va, vis et deviens - Armand Amar 
Secret Four - Anousheh, Tom 
Snatam Kaur - "Kabir's Song"

Please note: all of my recordings can be download via my Google Drive site, details under the COMMUNITY tab.

🎧 As a Buddhist nun, my intention with this channel is to offer these creative adaptations of spiritual teachings for the purpose of deepening spiritual understanding, contemplation, meditation, healing, devotion and relaxation for listeners.
